Key Match Events: James Rodríguez scored from the penalty spot and had an assist to help Colombia edge defending champion Argentina 2-1 in Barranquilla.
Diego Gómez scored for Paraguay from the edge of the box, with the ball deflecting in off goalkeeper Alisson’s right post.
Pre-Game Insights: The article does not provide pre-game insights.
Post-Match Reflections: ‘It is a great win against an Argentina team that has won it all,’ Rodríguez said.
Argentina’s coach Lionel Scaloni said the heat had an impact on the match.

Brazil’s coach, Dorival Júnior, told a news conference on Monday that his team will be in the next World Cup final. The defeat at Paraguay suggested he is still miles away from delivering on that promise.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 2022 World Cup winners also lifted the Copa America trophy in July after a 1-0 overtime victory over Colombia.
The Colombian team seemed to have that match on their minds as they found a way to beat Argentina for the first time since 2019.
The heat was the same for both teams, but it was evident that there were not good conditions for Argentina to see a spectacle.
Brazil’s squad doesn’t have 'the usual confidence' in recent times.
Paraguay collected a historic win that keeps the team in contention for a spot in the next World Cup.
